cum.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used between two nouns to show that something has two purposes
cum.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: when the price of shares is listed cum dividend or cum div, the person who buys them will receive the next DIVIDEND payment on them
cum.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: We can claim any trading losses made by buying stock cum dividend and then selling it ex-dividend against our tax liability.
cum.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: when a bond, security etc is cum interest, interest will paid on a particular date in the future, and this amount is included in its trading price
